e4: The current policy, though subject to potential scrutiny, currently avoids lying to investors. This has fostered a consistent pattern in the market.  The new-policy approach risks breaking this consistency and invites legal complications, potentially harming investor confidence long-term. e5: Ethical reporting comes from a balance of accuracy and transparency.  An ethical policy maintains an unbiased depiction of the company's financials while remaining clear about any inherent bias. It ensures consistent communication  with investors to foster trust, even if it means acknowledging the possibility of financial adjustments impacting performance over time. A truly ethical approach acknowledges that profit maximization is only one aspect of a successful business.
